title: In IPython torch.dot always returns 0
body_html:
When the code

import torch
print(torch.dot(torch.Tensor([2, 3]), torch.Tensor([2, 1])))

is run by IPython, it returns 0.0, which is obviously wrong. However it gives the correct result (i.e 7.0) when run by the normal python interpreter.

Some information about the system used for the test:

  • OS: OSX 10.13.3
  • PyTorch version: 0.3.1.post2
  • PyTorch was installed via conda install pytorch torchvision -c pytorch
  • Python version: 3.6.3
  • IPython version: 6.2.1
  • no CUDA installed

import torch

OS: OSX 10.13.3
PyTorch version: 0.3.1.post2
PyTorch was installed via conda install pytorch torchvision -c pytorch
Python version: 3.6.3
IPython version: 6.2.1
no CUDA installed
body:
When the code 

```python
import torch
print(torch.dot(torch.Tensor([2, 3]), torch.Tensor([2, 1])))
```

is run by IPython, it returns `0.0`, which is obviously wrong. However it gives the correct result (i.e `7.0`) when run by the normal python interpreter.

Some information about the system used for the test:
- OS: OSX 10.13.3
- PyTorch version: 0.3.1.post2
- PyTorch was installed via `conda install pytorch torchvision -c pytorch`
- Python version: 3.6.3
- IPython version: 6.2.1
- no CUDA installed
